TopicTitle: [1.12.x] Cryogenic Engines: Liquid Hydrogen and Methane Rockets! (Jan 22, 2022)

Articles.Content:
> 
> 
> 1 hour ago, M87T234G98O said:
> 
> 
> Hey, i installed the Near future methalox patch (by moving it from the Extras folder to the Gamedata folder, not sure if that was correct) and it doesnt seem to have had any effect
> 

I’m not at my computer and I’ll double check later, but I believe the patch you are talking about (NearFutureCryoEngines patch?) only affects two engines: the Lynx and the Cougar. It changes them to use 3 resources: Liquid Fuel, Liquid Hydrogen, and Oxidizer.

The rest of the engines in NFLV will remain <abbr title="Liquid Fuel"><abbr title="Liquid Fuel">LF</abbr></abbr>/O only.

And yes from your description it sounds like you installed it correctly.

**Edited <time datetime="2021-04-18T04:56:32Z" title="04/18/2021 04:56  AM" data-short="3 yr">April 18, 2021</time> by lemon cup**

Regarding IFS and b9partswitch, if you install IFS full mod, b9partswitch will try to disable itself if it detect IFS cfg available for that fuel tank. However, it fails horribly thus still both on. It causes duped resource bar. Anyway, you shouldn't use IFS at all as it provides Methane+liquid oxygen, not oxidizer. To fix it, use <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)"><abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">ckan</abbr></abbr> and install IFS **<u>core </u>**only. Then IFS wouldn't affect stock fuel tank thus metalox tank patch would work (or not since nertea said it automatically disable itself when it detect IFS). Alternatively use configurable containers with my methane patch.

It looks to have only affected a couple of cryogenic <abbr title="Reaction Control System">RCS</abbr> blocks, is this intended?

> 
> 
> 2 hours ago, M87T234G98O said:
> 
> 
> It looks to have only affected a couple of cryogenic <abbr title="Reaction Control System"><abbr title="Reaction Control System">RCS</abbr></abbr> blocks, is this intended?
> 

I don’t have that patch so I went to the latest github repository and poked around.

Basically, that patch pertains to some deprecated parts from older versions of NFLV, which are all currently hidden by a patch called “LegacyPartHider.cfg” If you were to delete this patch from the NearFutureLaunchVehicles/Legacy folder,  those old parts would show up, including the methalox engines.

In other words, if you have latest version of CryoTanks and CryoEngines, that patch is pointless; it’s just for old deprecated parts you shouldn’t use.

**Edited <time datetime="2021-04-18T15:15:11Z" title="04/18/2021 03:15  PM" data-short="3 yr">April 18, 2021</time> by lemon cup**

Thank you

Does the restock patch change the anomalously high performance <abbr title="Liquid Fuel and Oxidizer">LFO</abbr> engines like the vector and wolfhound to cryogenic ones?

> 
> 
> 3 hours ago, M87T234G98O said:
> 
> 
> Thank you
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Does the restock patch change the anomalously high performance <abbr title="Liquid Fuel and Oxidizer"><abbr title="Liquid Fuel and Oxidizer">LFO</abbr></abbr> engines like the vector and wolfhound to cryogenic ones?
> 

Yes and no. It converts the Vector, Mammoth, Rhino, Skipper, and Skiff to hydrolox engines and balances them accordingly. 

Other engines remain untouched, so the Wolfhound and Cheetah are still unrealistically overpowered. I personally avoid using those two.

what part of the cfg do I edit to remove the smoke trail the engines make? Surfacefx and the smoke effect itself didn't do anything

> 
> 
> 29 minutes ago, Natokerbal said:
> 
> 
> what part of the cfg do I edit to remove the smoke trail the engines make? Surfacefx and the smoke effect itself didn't do anything
> 

you should be looking for something like this:          

            PREFAB\_PARTICLE  

            {  

                prefabName = fx\_smokeTrail\_light  

                transformName = smokePoint  

            }
